intro: Henckelia robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. The flowers are usually blue or violet, and they bloom during the cooler months of the year.
